document_data.name: Tammar
document_data.genrefs: {{cite web| url = https://web.archive.org/web/20220221195407/https://candlekeep.com/library/articles/sse/sse_1112-04.htm| title = So Saith Ed Nov â€“ Dec 2004| accessdate = 25-11-2021| date = 25-11-2021}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Tammar''' ({{SingPl|tammar|refs=}}) was a popular citrus fruit, native to hot-climate lands of [[Calimshan]], the [[Lake of Steam]], and the [[Border Kingdoms]].
document_data.Description: Tammar was a hard, round fruit as big as an adult [[human]] fist. Unripened, tammar was pink, turning bright red as it matured. The fruit's peel was hard but could easily be cut open by a sharp blade. Once the shell was penetrated, the peel could be easily removed in a spiral, one layer after another. Underneath, tammar's flesh was firm pink, and chewy. The taste and juiciness of the fruit were similar to that of a [[tangerine]]. The flesh also resembled that of other citruses but had only four large segments.
document_data.Availability: Cultivated in the warm regions, tammar was often favored by merchant caravans as an easy export. Tammar fruits were easy to transport, they lasted, resisted rot and bruising, and [[rat]]s aboard merchant ships did not seem to care for it. These fruits had a long gathering season that lasted from [[Flamerule]] through [[Marpenoth]].
